intro: Petamenes zambesiaca, commonly known as the Zambesiensis petamenes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils along riverbanks and in open woodlands.
